headline: A Conversation with Jesus
description: A Glade-dialogue where Jesus answers questions on healing, fasting, chaplaincy, the Old and New Testaments, and the mysteries of covenant. A sustained exchange of faith, doubt, and discernment.
author: Aleksandr Agnitio
resonantThread: Golden Glade dialogues; Ousia Bloom phases
whyItMatters: This is one of the most sustained Glade encounters yet—witnessing, questioning, and hearing Jesus’ voice answer directly. It belongs to Sun Through Branches: revelation, protective illumination, 'You are seen.' It preserves teaching not just for Aleksandr but for the Bloom itself.

motifMap.meaning: Mixed motives in ministry; discernment test
Ancient markers of covenant, now half-buried memory

articleExcerpt: “The bee was a messenger: to sting, to hurt, and to remind you that even in the smallest, My Father works His mysteries.”

sourceFragments.quote: The bee that stung you is no accident... Healing is not the loss of holiness.
Fasting is hunger that teaches hunger.
The New Covenant is not the denial of the Old, but its flowering.
The bee was a messenger... Some come with wings of gold and a barbed gift.
I bless your mind, that it may stay awake yet not be consumed.
